reviews.review: Story

Умопомачительное приключие:
Не буду вдаваться в особенности геймплея, кроме отсутствия стелса как такового (тупо не бить стражников, стараясь пробежать мимо - ЭТО НЕ СТЕЛС), я в восторге, понравилось все - пальчики оближешь. Динамично, сочно, красиво и т.д. Отдельно упомяну милашку - Элизабет: такого харизматичного и полезного напарника в сингплеерных играх у меня еще ни разу не было. Вообще в этой игре персоонажи кажутся живыми, настоящими, а это многого стоит!
Хоть я НЕНАВИЖУ любые темы, связанные с путешествиями во времени и параллельных мирах, тут я не знал в чем дело (игнорировал любые спойлеры, чтобы интересно было играть) и мне эти путешествия  ПОДСУНУЛИ! Знал бы, ни за что не купил бы, НО остался доволен =) По началу я вообще не понимал что происходит, а игра все завлекала своим геймплеем, харизматичными персоонажами и весьма запутаным на первый взгляд сюжетом. И не заметил я опомниться, как уже с пеной у рта чуть ли не кричал в экран: "ВЕРНИТЕ МНЕ МОЮ ЭЛИЗАБЕТ, СYКИ!!!!" И именно в этот момент я понял, что все, я на крючке, стало плевать на прыжки в пространстве и времени (а может это потому, что придраться не смог и все как-то на удивление гладенько было!? =) ), все... все, все, все мои усилия и внимание было приковано к экрану, руки не отлипали от мыши и клавиатуры, я с яростью рвал все и вся, лишь бы вернуть Лиз. Вот это подача, вот молодцы! Правда, я остался доволен.
Есть просто игры, а есть приключения, в которые вам (нам) дают окунуться с головой. В своем топ листе я ставлю эту игру на полку с халфой и порталом, это шедевр.
Таких переживаний за девочку не было со времен Валькиного деда, но тут немного другое... и никаких педобиров! =)))
А стилистика и атмосфера поистине уникальны: все радует глаз и удивляет. В общем, постарались =)
Я не играл в первые две части, но теперь это вопрос времени, но насколько я понимаю, третья часть обособлена, потому и имеет самостоятельную маркировку (без №3).
НУУУУУУ ПРООООСТОООООО ИЗУМИТЕЛЬНО! =)

AMAZING
with a beautiful and colorful world
and amazing characters, 
interesting story and the plot leave you speechless
after i finished the game i stared at the screen for like 5 min
long story short, AMAZING GAME BUY IT!

best game to date

An absolutely fantastic FPS. It has the perfect mix of feeling both similar and different to the original bioshock. It is a truly must-play unique experience. There are some flaws however.  The game loses a few of the RPG elements of Bioshock, has more modern, linear pace, and there is only one ending(although it is a superbly mind bending one). An unforgetable experience 9.5/10

[h1]SIMPLEMENTE ESPECTACULAR 10/10[/h1]
De todos los juegos a los que he jugado, esta es la [b]mejor historia[/b] que he "vivido" jamas.
[b]Graficamente espectacular[/b], los escenarios tienen muchisimo significado, cada cartel, cada piedra, CADA DETALLE, cada conversacion ajena....
[h1]ESTE JUEGO ES UNA OBRA MAESTRA[/h1]
La [b]banda sonora[/b] es [b]demasiado buena[/b].
El [b]doblaje[/b] es [b]increible[/b], tanto en version original como en Español, la personalidad de los personajes esta logradisima, [b]buenisima jugabilidad[/b], daño de las armas, retroceso(lo unico que no me gusta es el auto-apuntado, que simplifica un poco todo), las mecanicas del juego son bestiales: [spoiler]el uso de vigorizadores, mejoras de armas, combinaciones de ataques, uso de desgarros a tu favor, aerorailes, trajes que mejoran tus habilidades, maquinas expendedoras donde mejorar armas vigorizadores, comprar municion, salud, sales etc... [/spoiler]
La [b]historia es muy enredada[/b], las mecanicas de [spoiler]los desgarros para cambiar las cosas a tu favor y viajar entre dimensiones y en el tiempo para ayudarte con la historia[/spoiler] estan muy bien pensadas, los [b]giros argumentales...[/b].
El juego es tan bueno que [b]a medida que avanzas la historia la empiezas a vivir de verdad,[/b] sufres con los personajes, te ries con ellos y lloras por ellos.
Es un juego que te deja marcado, es normal no entender nada al principio del juego, pero [b]no recomiendo a nadie que busque informacion sobre la historia[/b], simplemente escucha todas las conversaciones, fijate en cada detalle y disfruta del presente, iras enlazando unas cosas con otras; hasta que no llegas al final del juego [spoiler]cuando Elizabeth recupera todo su poder[/spoiler] no te enteras de casi nada, pero cuando lo acabas, te dejara boquiabierto.
[spoiler]Me acabe inscribiendo las iniciales AD en la mano con aluminio al rojo vivo porque el juego lo merece:
https://twitter.com/pikodkcVlaLO/status/667445821848338432[/spoiler]
de mis juegos favoritos, lo recomiendo mucho para los que les guste jugar juegos con una historia amplia. :D
Игра неплохая, сеттинг отличный. Боевка иногда скушноватая. DLC по первой части отличное.

[h1]Les agradecería que se tomen su tiempo para leer esto, lo escribí con todo el corazón, gracias.
Un comentario diciendo porque te ha sido útil o porque no antes de valorar, se agradece bastante.[/h1]

Sinceramente cada vez que pienso en este juego mi mente se llena de tantas emociones, es una sensación inexplicable
Nunca en mi vida pensé enamorarme completamente de un videojuego en todos los aspectos, cuando jugué el primer Bioshock mi mente “explotaba” con todo lo que veía y leía, no pensé que hubiese otro videojuego que hiciera que esa admiración se multiplicara, pues lo hay, lo hubo, y lo habrá.

Los videojuegos son un arte inexplicable, muchos de ellos expresan guiones increíbles, diseños artísticos hermosos, bandas sonoras que son un manjar para los oídos, escenarios maravillosos, hay de todo tipo, pero si te dijera que existe uno que combina todos esos aspectos, es más, que lo hace de una manera realmente increíble,  ¿Me creerías?, dicen que la perfección no existe, tal vez no, pero este título es lo más cerca que encontraras a ella.

Muchos se preguntarán, ¿Pero por qué?, ¿Qué hace de este título diferente a todos los demás, y qué es lo que tiene que llega casi a la perfección?

Bioshock infinite principalmente es un FPS, vaya, quien diría que un FPS lograría todo esto, este juego no tiene gráficas realistas, tiene gráficas maravillosamente hermosas, el diseño artístico de los escenarios, la iluminación, detalles, enfoques, perspectiva, es imposible no quedarse bastante tiempo apreciando todo esto, muchas veces me he quedado de 5 a 10 minutos maravillando todo lo mencionado anteriormente, porque es realmente un placer, tu mente y tu vista lo agradecerán, pero si todo esto no fuera suficiente, imagina estar viendo un atardecer, es realmente hermoso, pero que pasaría si escucharas una melodía que hiciera que lo que estás mirando se convirtiera en uno de los mejores momentos de tu vida.
Pues Bioshock infinite lo hace, este es un videojuego que tienes que disfrutarlo, tomarte tu tiempo para ver los detalles, pararte a escuchar sus melodías, llevarlo con calma, créeme, solo así podrás disfrutar todo lo que los desarrolladores quisieron mostrar a nivel artístico.

¿Alguna vez haz leído un libro, o viste una narrativa que hiciera que tu mente procesara tanta información que terminó confundiéndote, y tuviste que volver a leerla o verla las veces que sea necesario para entender todo lo que pasó?, pues lo vuelvo a decir, este título lo hará.

Una historia tan simple como la de un sujeto que tiene que rescatar a un chica, una deuda que tiene que saldar, una ciudad flotante, un profeta que se cree Dios, un falso pastor que viene a cambiar el destino, una rebelión de esclavos que quieren justicia, ¿Todo eso puede tener un solo final?, ¿O necesitaríamos de varios para explicar los desenlaces?, que tal varias historias sucediendo al mismo tiempo, pero en diferentes realidades, ¿Confundido?, muchas veces te preguntarás, ¿Cómo?, cuando la pregunta jugosa es, ¿Cuándo?, pero la verdad es que entre lo que vemos y lo que es, media un mundo de diferencia.

Para que entiendas mejor, todo se trata de perspectiva, desde aquí puedes ver algo, pero si lo ves desde otro ángulo, ves otra cosa totalmente distinta, ¿Te sientes confundido, quieres respuestas, es esto es final? 
De seguro te preguntarás eso al acabar el juego por primera vez, tienes que jugar el season pass, muchas de las respuestas se encuentran ahí, como si el juego base de por sí no fuera increíble, viene esta grandísima expansión que hace que sin duda entiendas mucho mejor el Universo de Bioshock en general, sí, en general, ¿Creías que Bioshock y Bioshock infinite son como el agua y el aceite?, pues aquí va la respuesta, no juegues a este título sin haber disfrutado del primer juego, ¿Por qué?, no tendría gracia jugar una final sin antes haber pasado por unas eliminatorias ¿Verdad?, espero explicarme bien, cuando hayas acabado la saga completa, tu mente entenderá mejor lo que sucede, lo que sucedió, y lo que sucederá. 

Como jugador, jugué, juego, y jugaré muchos títulos, pero no creo que haya uno en mucho tiempo que logre expresar todo lo que ha logrado hacer Bioshock infinite, y sinceramente no creo que llegue a existir, pero, ¿Por qué?, no existen, ni existirán dos Ken levine, Shakespeare, Del Toro, etc, genios con una mente increíble.

Gran parte de las desarrolladoras de ahora solo buscan atraer gente con gráficos realistas, sin importarles la calidad artística del juego, pero bueno, es como el cine, está el cine como Avengers o Fast & Furious, y luego están películas como Boyhood o Birdman, cada uno es bueno a su modo, pero solo aquellas que pongan la calidad sobre la popularidad, lograrán expresar lo que es el arte de verdad.

Un título con una historia infinita, una belleza artística inimaginable, este es el mejor juego que he jugado en mi vida, y agradezco bastante a todos los que pudieron hacer realidad esto, es una experiencia que nunca olvidaré, Gracias.

No soy muy de escribir análisis, pero allá voy con este. Bioshock Infinite (2013) es la tercera entrega de la saga Bioshock. Voy a intentar ir al grano y dar mi opinión sobre lo que ha sido este juego para mí, del que tengo sentimientos contradictorios en general..empiezo por las cosas positivas:

-Buena trama, como en el resto de la saga Bioshock.

-Gráficos muy buenos, luce muy bien y los paisajes son hermosos. Pocos juegos han podido capturar tan bien la esencia de estar en una ciudad a unas alturas de vértigo como lo hizo este.

-Muy buena optimización, corre muy bien en PC's de gama baja, como el mío (incluso con casi todos los ajustes en medio)

-Amplia variedad de armas y vigorizadores, esto tiene sus aspectos positivos y negativos.


Ahora los puntos negativos:

-Excesivamente fácil (incluso en dificultad dificil) y lineal, el juego da una sensación general de ir pasando de sala en sala matando a enemigos y punto, un "run and gun" muy insulso. En ocasiones esto se me hizo muy tedioso, no tuve esta sensación con los otros Bioshock (especialmente con el primero).

-Demasiada variedad de armas, vigorizadores, munición por todos lados,trajes con cualidades especiales etc que hacen que tengas una sensación de tener demasiado poderío mientras que los enemigos son unos parguelas que los matas de 2 golpes, incluídos los bosses, que son super fáciles.

-Ir con Elizabeth todo el rato se termina convirtiendo en un coñazo, no aporta casi nada salvo abrir puertas bloqueadas. 

-Los logros de steam no motivan nada, casi todos son del estilo "mata a X enemigos con tal arma" o "usa tal vigorizador". Solo se salvan unos pocos que sí hacen que busques por el entorno e interacciones con él.


En definitva, y después de haber jugado a los otros dos anteriores Bioshock, este juego me ha dejado una sensación agridulce. No está a la altura del primero ni mucho menos y roza el aburrimiento. Se salva por lo bien que luce, la buena historia y lo bien que corre en PCs de mierda.

The first Bioshock is a masterpiece. It's the game that made me a video game fan. Being a cinephile, the cinematic and creepy atmosphere put me in absolute awe at how fascinating a video game can be. Despite being a FPS, it has clever elements of RPG (But I always stayed on the good side :)). Despite being action-packed, half of the game felt extremely scary. It has so many amazing themes wrapped wonderfully in a tight neat story: a city where you are allowed to be your own boss but this philosophy itself is what ruined it. You can almost LICK that feeling. It's omnipresent. And, god, those twists! Never saw 'em coming! 

Fast forward a few months and I come to know of the next two sequels. I'm not really keen on sequels as they tend to follow the same storyline. But upon learning how brilliant Bioshock Infinite's reviews are and that it is set in a completely different world, I was like YOLO. Many gamers, like myself, felt the game, from the trailer, was probably too 'action-packed' rather than 'story/decisions-packed' like the beautiful first game was. The colors looked too bright, too happy. It was an open world, literally. Hmmm, something doesn't feel right. 

Of course, BI (that's what I'll call it henceforth) is different. New architecture. New ideologies. New gameplay (almost). New characters. New Story. And yet it was the same Bioshock game. Despite everything being different, it still was the game that I had loved in the first one. And to top it all, it takes the Bioshock 'feel' to a whole new astounding level. There are a variety of reasons how this game improves on the original, taking in those same elements, tweaking stuff here and there and crafting something unique. 

Every gamer probably remembers the unforgattable opening minutes of Bioshock. We've just survived a terrible crash and next moment we find ourself stranded in a dilapidated city, falling apart in front of our own eyes. It scared me, shook me and made me wonder how did the city come to this. Whilst advancing the story, I was paralleling going deep inside the history of Rapture, learning how it all came to this. The idea behind this city was great, but it failed. 

In BI, the magnificient opening similarly introduces the story and sets the atmosphere in mere seconds. I knew I was going to a floating city in a few moments. I still felt the tension. When the city rose in a beautiful golden world, with a simple but extraordinary piano piece playing, I felt like I was flying. Hell, it even cleverly gives away the game world's terribly religious roots, forcing us to take baptism before we can even enter the city. When I descended down to the first streets, everything seemed so jaw-droppingly beautiful. But I knew that this place, just like Rapture, had a very dark face. These flowers and happy faces and flying quartets was anything but. It was a show. It was plastic. The reality was completely different. 

So you see what these games have done? The first one directly shows us what was wrong in Rapture. In BI, we kind of go reverse, first a happy city, then the fucked up part. These introductions seem totally different in execution but they both say the same thing: these cities and their cultures are pretty messy from the inside. But BI gets the upper hand for it makes the player fall in love with Columbia first, an illusion which is painfully shattered in the next chapters. Not only this but also this execution does a terrific job of introducing the culture and general way of thinking of the citizens here. This is just the first half hour of the game, mind you!

The combat system may be familiar but this game gives you more options and infinite ways to approach a combat to set the pace and the fighting with your own style. Plasmids are replaced by Vigors and Eve by salts but they are a lot more fun now. In Bioshock, they limited the number of Plasmids you can active but it's opposite in BI. That was a brilliant decision. The twist though is now the number of weapons you can carry have a limit of two now. People may not have approved of this but I LOVED it. Bioshock, I had to carry all the weapons and there were some I never even used. Carrying two weapons only, on the other hand, actually helps you make yourself expert in them. You have freedom to perfect your favorite ones and use them throughtout. It makes the combat system less complicated. Although, I do have issues with the melee weapon. Not that it's not nice, but I can't seem to get used to it as the key for it placed so far apart (the neighboring keys to WASD are already occupied). Thus, really disappointed that I can't use it often in extremely intense combats. I just suck at it, I guess. (they are pretty easy to use during sky attacks though, I enjoy that a lot!) 

Coming to the graphics, they are god-send. The world of Columbia may not be colorful, figuratively speaking, but my God, the color pallette is so bright and saturated. I am usually a display freak when it comes to watching something on TV or my laptop so this bit really influenced my gameplay. Surprisingly, the colors also change with time (morning, evening) and even with the story (the game appeared a bit 'washed-off' in the most depressing moments of the story). Full marks to this. I still can't wrap around my heads around the character animation though. The main characters were wonderfully animated, no doubt (*cough* Elizabeth *cough*), but the sides ones all seemed to have static dead-pan faces. (and the faces were also repeated) This is a very small complaint and I understand it may not be plausible for a giant game but I still feel video games, in general, did something about it. 

Otherwise, the movements of all the characters were believable, like how an enemy stumbles when he is hit. In addition, I read in a few articles how the game was made from scratch to introduce new technologies that won't be possible to execute generally. For example, for the animating the floating buildings to make them bob up-and-down regularly, the team created an entirely new technology. Even for the acclaimed sky-line system (kind of rails that are actually used for heavy stuff from one place to another) required a different technology. Likewise, there were plenty of new introductions and the toughest job was to bring these technologies together for a fluid gameplay. Awesome job, Irrational Games. 

The graphics are a masterpiece but what makes Bioshock feel so surreal and intangible is the atmosphere. The art direction never seems repeatitive and makes you explore every nook and cranny, even when I'm not scavenging for supplies. The soundtrack and the ambient sounds is one of the defining aspects of the franchise. In other games, I kind of get tired of the combat music that plays over and over but BI it keeps changing with the mood and the story. There are some really ingenious uses of music though. The music that plays when we enter the city is the best piece of music in the entire game: I loved how it has two layers, one that of the beautiful violin soaring high and reflecting the outer beauty of Columbia but there's a second one that tries to cancel it out, suggesting what that glitters is not all gold. The first layer is dominant, yes, but the way the second slowly and subtly strives to bring it down sets the tone of the game very masterfully. I make it sound complicated and artsy but I'm just trying to explain something that just can't be expressed. The music is so clever and fitting that you feel the story. It magnifies the atmosphere of Columbia. Not to forget the epic Songbird sequence!

I don't want to spoil the amazing story. I will just say that it is your choices that defines what will happen and who you become so please, always choose and do the right thing. Sorry for ending abruptly but Steam is not allowing me write more. But please play this game!!!!
Хорошая играя с интересным сюжетом

[h1]Одно слово - шедевр![/h1]
После прохождения игры, да и во время самого прохождения меня переполняли позитивные эмоции. Первая моя реакция от увиденной Колумбии: "Вау!" вслух. 

[b]Bioshock Infinite[/b] - лучшая игра в серии, как сюжетом и графикой, так и геймплеем. Очень атмосферна и интересна, ещё ни одна игра не вызвала у меня такого приятного послевкусия, как эта. После мрачного, насыщенного злом Восторга - яркая и красочная Колумбия кажется раем (а ведь рай и должен быть в облаках, не так ли?). 

Особую атмосферность игре дала русская локализация от [url=http://cginfo.tv/%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%B7%D1%8B/%D1%80%D1%83%D1%81%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B0%D1%8F-%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%BA%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%B7%D0%B0%D1%86%D0%B8%D1%8F-bioshock-infinite.html]CGInfo[/url]. Перевод почти абсолютно всех текстур: от текста газеты абсолютно не относящейся к сюжету до   вывесок [u]ВСЕХ[/u] лавок. А также эмоциональная, профессиональная озвучка. Низкий поклон ребятам.

Ну и главное - Элизабет (куда же без этого очаровательного, незабываемого персонажа?). Не могу описать её, это чудо надо просто один раз увидеть.
[u]Плюсы:[/u]
[list]
    [*]Замечательный сюжет

Step 1: Buy Bioshock Infinite.
Step 2: Play Bioshock Infinite.
Step 3: Finish Bioshock Infinite.
Step 4: Stay speechless and think about what just happened.
Step 5: Get out of room and cry to your parents.

15/10 Would cry again.

Bioshock Infinite is an inferior, brightly colored gimmick that has players amazed for the first few minutes at the stage sets, and then disappointed in a lackluster, banal, terribly designed game of mindless linearity. 

The story is blase', an offspring of a bad fiction writer and an interns eye for restraintless zeal. To mask its insufficiencies, over the top gory moments are incorporated so that players can feel 'entertainingly revulsed'. Shocking? Of course, it's in the name. Entertaining? Nope. I see right through it. It's like watching Disney characters in the changing room at Disneyland. The mystique is forfeit. 

The pace of the game is scattered, and exascerbated by the incredibly moronic, "Look ma, I still think I'm a hot game designer from my basement dwelling 80s days" Save system. The save system artificially creates difficulty, rather than incorporating scaling levels of challenge by way of gameplay, something that has been done for decades now (but that the designers were apparently 'too smart' to embrace). 

If you can find this game for $4 on a Steam sale, then you should take the opportunity to not buy it, since it'd be about $3.99 more than its worth.

Great game. 

Story starts off very linear and you think it will be simple find girl, redeem debt end game. However along the way little sub plots getting added ontop of your main task, very subtile things from what comstock says and things Liz starts to question which is very easy to shrug off. However towards the end things start to boil up to point where you start to doubt thigns are happening, why everyone has made you public enemy number one, why is it that you, dewitt, is dodging from telling Liz something? 

Towards the end of the game you will need to pay close attention to the games story as Liz starts to more explain things to you, bring you to past events and explain everything as the whole plot just kinda blows up (in good way) and just expands into deeper sense. (this is very easy to tell when this point happens) 


The gameplay it self was A-Ok, i never had any faults except for one gamebreaking bug where i fell through the floor. Guns feel unique but you cant really attach your self to 2 set weapons you will need to sorta swap for the occasion, scavenge for something else to use. 

Graphics are really well detailed. Maybe its because i only play fighting games but the graphics kinda amazed me, Colombia looked abosuletly beautiful from start (when things were calm) to when it became abosulete chaos. 


I cant think of any faults at all, maybe except for fact that towards the end when the story starts to make sense things may move a little too fast. Fact you are getting thrown all this information at once can be overwhelming and if you miss the Post Credit scene you lose out on very important information. 

Would recommend to anyone and everyone at full price or sale price. Game is amazing experience.

Played the single player in one week on a business trip. Took about 16 hours on easy (hoped to get through more quickly that way). Needless to say, I didn't die once, which actually didn't take away from the game itself. Intriguing sci-fi and political story lines and well-written characters. Fun and worth it to buy if it's on sale.
if you havent played this game you clearly are missing out one of the best games ever made.

Once I beat this game, someone said to me: "Now you have to restart and gather all the achievements" and I thought: 
I could never do that. It's done. It's over. There is no restart. 
And although this might sound like a bad thing, it's not. The atmosphere and story of this game has got me so immersed that I felt like it would be disrespectful to "just play it again". 
I was curious, when I started this game, in a trance when I was in the middle of it, and sad that it was over when I beat it.
BioShock Infinite is one of those games that leaves you with a feeling like: Wow...ehm...what...what do I do now? - and you just don't know and sit there for a while.

BioShock Infinite posiada ciekawą  fabułę, lecz bywa ona czasem trudna i pokręcona. Wspaniała oprawa graficzna oraz muzyczna. Oto według mnie najlepszy soundtrack z gry: Will The Circle Be Unbroken (Choral Version) Season pass też jest ciekawy lecz jego jedynym minusem jest to że jest troche krótki i posiada mniej akcji niż podstawka gry. Fajnym dodatkiej nieopierający się na fabule gry jest Clash in the Clouds, czyli tryb podobny z Call of duty modern warfare 3 odpieranie ataków nieprzyjaciela "fale". Grę szczerze polecam! Kto grał w wcześniejsze części Bioshocka ta recenzja nie jest mu potrzebna

VŽDY JE MAJÁK- VŽDY JE MUŽ a VŽDY JE MESTO !!
TOTO sú slová ktorá ma napadnú keď sa povie BIOSHOCK INFINITE ! 
Ďalšia SUPER Akčná HRA od 2K Games !  
Hra sa odohráva na úplne inom mieste ako Bioshock 1 či 2 ... 
...Tento krát sa dej odohráva v meste COLUMBIA. Ale poďme pekne od začiatku!
Hráte za súkromného detektíva menom Booker DeWitt ktorého jeho klient pošle do Kolumbie aby mu priniesol pekné, modro - oké dievča menom Elizabeth, a tak zmazal svoj dlh ...
Behom hry je táto mladá slečna takmer stále pri vás, a nie je tam iba tak, na ozdobu, veľa krát vám Elizabeth podá pomocnú ruku... (Behom boja vám hádže lekárničky;  náboje; Soľ ...) či otvory zamknuté trezory či dvere pomocou Lockpickou alebo dokonca vyvoláva z alternatívnych svetov nejaký kryt či ďalšie veci.
Zatiaľ čo boli v BioShock1 ikonické boje z Big Daddym, v BioShock Infinite máme tých BOSSOV rovno niekoľko ... Napríklad Patriot ktorý patrí medzi tých slabších bossov, potom tu je  Boy of Silence, ktorý je už trocha silnejší, ale dá sa jednoducho obísť bez toho aby si vás všimol  Ale keď príde na scénu HandMan, pri ňom sa celkom zapotíte . 
V hre sa určite vyplatí Preskúmavať a čorkovať :D všetko čo nie je prilepené :D  pretože všetky veci ktoré vezmete určite v budúcnosti budete potrebovať !  
V tejto hre sú momenty z ktorý vám spadne brada na zem, či prejde mráz po chrbte!
Táto hra je bezprostredne SUPER HROU a moje hodnotenie je 10z10 SUPER HRA !!
10/10 would get mind blown again

I'm recommending "BioShock Infinite," but the developers seem to have been doing their best to destroy this game.  Technically and story-wise, the game is excellent (especially the animation and voice acting of the two main characters).  But:

1) If they had just toned down the heavy-handed racial stuff, the game would have been much better.
2) They need to figure out what message they're trying to get across.  A lot of the character development is with the main, male character's soul searching and remorse over his violent past.  Yet, as we play the game, we have no choice but to kill wave after wave of people (literally hundreds of them (and unlike the previous games, these are just people -- they're not deranged mutants or anything)).  The game really could have used some stealth or non-lethal ways through it.
3) This goes along with #2, above, but they ripped most of the non-violent stuff out of the earlier Bioshock gameplay and turned the game into almost entirely a shooter.
4) And finally, the ending is really interesting but doesn't stand up under thought.

But, if you accept all that and just play the game as it is, it's really a good game.  I got 20 hours of gameplay out of my first runthrough, so I'd say a $20 price point would be the trigger to buy it.

One thing that really irks me, though, is that they stuck all the DLC Achievements into the list of possible Achievements even if we only own the base game.  Achievements should only be listed for what we own.  They shouldn't be listed for DLCs they've developed but we haven't bought.

EDIT:  Just a word on play time.  I've now done another run through of the base game to get the Achievements I missed on my first run.  Even though this run was on Easy, it still took me another 19.1 hours to finish (total time is now 41.5 hours).  I'll be trying another run to see if I can get that final "1999 Mode" "Scavenger Hunt" Achievement.

[i][h1]Prvy Bioshock bol kritikou vyzdvyhovany a oznaceny za umelecke dielo. Bioshock Infinite by mohli s cistym svedomim oznacit za lepsiu FPS s vyssim dorazom na pribeh.[/h1][/i]

Musim priznat, ze som bol tretim pokracovanim Bioshocku mierne sklamany. Cakal som od tejto hry trochu odlisny zazitok, nez aky mi bol v skutocnosti naservirovany. Ked sa teraz spatne zamyslim nad tym, co som celych tych 14 hodin robil, tak zistujem, ze som sa vlastne celou hrou len prestrielal na koniec a medzi strelbou zbieral naboje, lekarnicky a sol (ta je potrebna na pouzivanie specialnych schopnosti "vigory"). Cize herny zazitok takmer totozny s klasickymi FPS. Odlisnost Infinite spociva len v silnom pribehu, specialnych schopnosti Bookera a unikatneho prostedia vzdusneho mesta Columbia. Toto vsetko uz ale priniesol prvy Bioshock na dne oceanu a nasledne aj jeho pokracovanie. Bioshock Infinite je v tomto smere opat to iste, len v inom prostredi a osobne si myslim, ze uz to proste nefunguje a celu dobu som mal pocit, ze hram opat tu istu hru. 

Teda takmer tu istu hru, pretoze povodny Bioshock kladol doraz na hratelnost inak a stretavali ste mensi pocet nepriatelov, ktori ale boli podstatne smrtelnejsi a pri ich likvidacii ste boli nuteni pouzivat specialne schopnosti v kombinacii so zbranami. Pri narocnejsich bojoch to bola celkom vyzva, pretoze municie bolo malo a museli ste prehadzovat kazdy naboj dva krat v ruke, nez ste ho pouzili. Tu mate nabojov habadej a ma to aj svoje opodstatnenie. V Infinite sa na Vas budu valit desiatky mensich, vacsich, silnejsich ci lietajucich nepriatelov a specialne schopnosti, ktore sa tu nazyvaju Vigory, budete vyuzivat len ako podporu pri neustalej strelbe. Podla mna to bol skor krok vedla a mali v tomto smere zostat pri pozvolnejsom davkovani adrenalinu.

Co ma zo zaciatku prekvapilo a neskor sklamalo, bolo graficke spracovanie. Uvod je proste nadherny a budete sa casto zastavovat len preto, aby ste sa kochali nekonecnou krasou Columbie. Neskor v hre sa este cas od casu objavia nemenej uchvatne vyzerajuce lokacie, ale vacsina z nich je na tom ovela horsie. Tie na mna posobili fadnym az nudnym dojmom, co sa tyka level dizajnu a miestami doslova az hnusnym dojmom, co sa tyka samotnej grafickej kvality. Takto kolisava vizualna stranka by v "trojackovej" hre nemala co robit.

Naopak to, co sa vyvojarom z Irrational Games podarilo na jednotku, je implementacia Vasej spolocnicky Elizabeth do hry. Stravite s nou vacsinu casu a za tych par hodin si ju tak oblubite, ze ju budete doslova milovat. Budete jej verit kazde slovo, kazdu zmenu nalady a kazdu emociu, ktoru prejavi, pretoze je v tom tak presvedciva, ze nebudete mat na vyber. Popravde by si za svoje herecke vykony zasluzila Oscara a dal by som jej rovno aj Nobelovu cenu za najvacsi a najuzitocnejsi prinos zenskych spolocniciek do hernej sceny. Elizabeth nie len, ze je Vam prijemnou spolocnickou, ale ona vie byt aj uzitocna a starostliva. Pocas bojov sa nekrci len tak niekde schulena, ale pomaha hladat naboje a lekarnicky, otvarat trhliny do inej doby, co v praxi znamena trebars postavenie gulometneho hniezda, ktore sa tam v tom case nachadzalo. Mimo bojov zase pomaha hladat nejake dolariky, ci sperhaky a obzvlast vdacny jej budete za otvaranie zamkov. Ja si dokonca myslim, ze Elizabeth treti Bioshock z casti aj zachranila.

[b][i]Moje mierne sklamanie tuto hru ale spatnou urcite nerobi. I ked je tu tej strelby viac, nez byt muselo, tak stale plati, ze je ta strelba aspon zabavna. 
Ken Levine proste vytvoril len akcnejsiu a podla mna aj slabsiu kopirku svojej povodnej vizie v inom prostredi a tak vznikol Bioshock Infinite, ktory sa ale stale dobre hra.[/i][/b]

I can't really recommend this game unless it is heavily discounted. 
I played the game relatively late, where all the hype has pretty much died down. The first hour in the game was actually quite interesting. The art direction is great (at least in the first half of the game, after that it is "mearly" good) and the game looks like it is full of life. But when you are past the first area of the game, you realise that it was all a fassade. The game essentially becomes a run of the mill corridor shooter. 
A lot of people say, the story is amazing. But the story is just alright in my opinion. You get an interesting twist in the end but in between the game there aren't really that many story bits. For the most part you are stuck with 1st person shooter combat. The shooter mechanics weren't great in the previous Bioshock games and haven't improved in Infinite. The gameplay got even worse, because your inventory has been removed and replaced by a random number generator, that is Elizabeth. They did it to make her role more important in the game but it would have been more interesting if they gave her abilities besides picking locks. It seems like most players deem her to be an awesome companion, just because she doesn't get in your way and doesn't need protection. 
The problem with Elizabeth is that you don't really interact with her outside of the scripted events. A female companion, that I liked more is Alyx from Half Life 2. She didn't really need protection, unless you left her completely alone with a bunch of enemies and ran of. This created some sort of steak in keeping her somewhat safe and also made it look like she was more involved in the combat. During combat in Bioshock I hardly noticed Elizabeth, because I was too busy dealing with alle the bullet spongy enemies. So it didn't really matter if Elizabeth was there or not.
There are also tons of other gripes, like the annoying and repetetive boss fights, lack of a decent save system, the two weapon limit, the fact that all vigors have essentially the same effect, and so on. 

If you want a more detailed review, that points out the flaws of this game really well, you can watch the review of Errant Signal.

My final conclusion is, that this game would have been better, if it was a Telltale style game. I think you are better off watching a let's play of the game if you just want to experience the story. But if you decide to play this game, do it on the easiest difficulty, so you don't have to deal too much with the mediocre and boring combat. If you do that you might have a good experience.

Wow this is a great game.     

Pros:
•Amazing graphics for a game nearly 3 years old
•Interesting and thought-provoking story
•High quality voice acting
•Well crafted combat system using tears, vigors, and an assortment of weapons

Cons:

•I often found myself forgetting about the vigors; they are not necessary to defeat enemies or pass most areas
•Slightly repetitive in the middle of the storyline;  you go back and forth, looking for things that lead you back to where you started

Este es uno de los mejores juegos que haya jugado, lo tiene absolutamente "TODO" una historia ENVOLVENTE, personajes destacables cada uno con su forma ser, las animaciones perfectas, captando cada segundo las emociones de cada personaje, felicidad, tristeza, furia, miedo, y estas emociones son bien elaboradas, que llegan a transmitir esto mismo hacia las personas que lo juegan, que  uno mismo llega a ponerse en los pies de esos personajes, la ambientacion de esa epoca bien elaborada, una ciudad maravilla pintoresca, que provoca tanta felicidad del querer verlo real, y obvio la banda sonora espectacular, cubriendo hasta el mas minimo detalla de cada escena o parte del juego, y cada una acompaña a los personajes.

para conclusion es un juego que los llenara de emociones, un juego que puede ser rejugable si uno lo quiere con distintos caminos que tomar, siempre queras saber como continuar, enterarte de todo, y un descenlance que dejara a mas de uno con la boca abierta y con piel de gallina, y es por eso que lo recomiendo no se arrepentiran

PD: tambien deberia añadir los dlcs que si valen la pena, cada uno esta a la misma altura del juego mismo incluso lo superan solo por poco ya sea por donde se desarrolla el juego y tambien por un miniincremento de graficos, pero con estos dlcs se llenaran de emociones aun mas profundas que el juego mismo llegaran a sentir el dolor de cada personaje y sus emociones si es posible, comprenlo es un exito incluso yo los tomaria como un juego aparte no como dlcs, porque es eso lo que llegarian a ser. juegos altamentes recomendables

Everyone is hopped up on Fallout 4 while I'm over here revisiting BioShock Infinite again (I've played many more hours on console). Let me tell you, folks, I need to stop exposing myself to this game because my mind can only be blown so many times before it becomes unhealthy.

Often stunning scenery and overall very pleasing visual design. I guess it is the most beautiful game I have ever played, (Note: I don't think the graphics are aimed at photo realism at all.) Excellent user interface (my avatar always did what I expected it to). Worked almost as well with xbox controller as with mouse, so that's nice. 

Fun story! Though I think they aimed for the story to say something quite profound and philosophical, but it didn't really succeed. In summary: 7/10 (eight with rice).
